intro: Chiritopsis mollifolia, commonly known as silky chiritopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Chiritopsis mollifolia is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, making it well adapted to arid environments.
